forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: A chance of rain. Mostly cloudy, with a low around 52. South wind around 6 mph. Chance of precipitation is 50%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

forecast.name: Tuesday
forecast.detailedForecast: A chance of rain. Mostly cloudy. High near 58, with temperatures falling to around 54 in the afternoon. Southwest wind 3 to 7 mph. Chance of precipitation is 30%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

weather_report:
As night settles over Downtown San Francisco, a cool breeze whispers through the city streets. Though the hour is late, the remnants of the day’s clamor linger in the air, merging with the low probability of rain looming on the horizon. Clusters of clouds gather above, casting a gentle shadow across the skyline, hinting that a subtle dampness may accompany the expected chill. With temperatures hovering around a brisk 52 degrees, the atmosphere is not uninviting but calls for a discerning choice in attire—think layers, perhaps a light jacket to ward off the evening’s potential drizzle and its accompanying bite.

Tomorrow promises a little more of the same—clouds will blanket the sky, with a notable chance of rain still dancing on the edge of possibility. The high will barely crest 58 degrees before slipping back into the cooler embrace of the afternoon at around 54. The air will remain heavy, with a soft southwest wind offering little more than a gentle caress, but it might just be enough to rustle the leaves and stir a cozy sense of introspection. It would be a fine time for a quiet walk along the Embarcadero or perhaps a serene afternoon seated in one of the city’s intimate cafes, sipping on something warm while the world outside wades through its own rhythms of rain and quiet. 

Given the murkiness enveloping the Golden Gate and the hazy outlines of the cityscape, one might find a certain charm in this cloak of fog and mystery. It's a reminder of the city’s more tranquil side, an invitation to slow down, perhaps dive into a good book, or explore the nearby art galleries, keeping one’s thoughts as fluid as the drifting clouds above.
